issue.title: Helm 3 - legacy dependency conditions not respected

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
Output of `helm version`:
```
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.0-alpha.1", GitCommit:"b9a54967f838723fe241172a6b94d18caf8bcdca", GitTreeState:"clean"}
```

Output of `kubectl version`:
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"14", GitVersion:"v1.14.1", GitCommit:"b7394102d6ef778017f2ca4046abbaa23b88c290", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-04-08T17:11:31Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"14", GitVersion:"v1.14.1+IKS", GitCommit:"7212ba91727da63ce9cfb2b5eba7f988f0f125d0", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-05-09T14:28:29Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): 
IBM Cloud (IKS)


I have a helm 2 chart that includes another chart by this content in requirements.yaml
```
dependencies:
  - name: cp-helm-charts
    version: 0.1.0
    repository: https://confluentinc.github.io/cp-helm-charts/
    condition: kafka.internal.enabled
  - name: openldap
    version: 0.3.0
    repository: https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com/
```

However if kafka.internal.enabled is set to false (in my case values.yaml sets it to true, but I have content in an additional file specified by '-f ~/cloud.yaml which sets it to false), the cp-helm-chart (confluent kafka) IS deployed regardless

body: Note: this issue is actually due to nested directories under `templates/` and nothing to due with dependencies

rename.from: Helm 3: issue with registries and chart dependencies
rename.to: Helm 3: issue with registries and nested templates

body: Upon removing the `wordpress/templates/tests/`, everything works as expected and mariadb chart .tgz is present on export

@jdolitsky are you planning to PR a fix this week? If you want to ship a fix for the beta, you're more than welcome to, but if you're not planning on PR'ing a fix I'd like to de-prioritize this and move it to the 3.0.0 milestone. Bugfixes shouldn't hold up the beta release; those can be fixed during the beta release cycle. :)

@bacongobbler I'm planning to, but we shall see where I get (I'm not sure how involved it might be). If it appears to be too much, I'll switch the milestone asap.

Maybe related to this TODO from 2016? https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/dev-v3/pkg/chartutil/save.go#L205

issue.title: fix(chartutil): Ensure nested template dir on save

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
If a templates/ dir of a chart contained a subdirectory, for example "templates/tests/test-db.yaml", an error was being thrown on export due to missing the "templates/test" directory prior to saving the template file itself.

Example chart with nested template, stable/wordpress: https://github.com/helm/charts/blob/master/stable/wordpress/templates/tests/test-mariadb-connection.yaml

This was apparently being done for chart.Files but not chart.Templates - I've combined the logic for both fields.

Fixes #5757

cc @bacongobbler
